author: holiman
content: Let's be conservative when rolling out new features on mainnet. Using some "oh no that's not fair because of historic reason" reasoning doesn't hold any water with me

author: holiman
content: (^ in the context of Marius / Dankrad discussion about blob limits on ACD)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> it's not historic reasons. If the current gas limits allows blocks that you think are unsafe for mainnet, we should be restricting mainnet block size (either by adding a limit or by increasing calldata cost). Blobs are safer due to decoupling

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> > <adietrichs>  I‚Äôd join in a few min üôÇ (re @allcoredevs_bot: <0xraino> #party-lounge?)

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> > <adietrichs>  I would personally favor a calldata cost increase in Cancun to address this. also adds an extra incentive for rollups to transition to blob data asap (re @allcoredevs_bot: <M H Swende (holiman)> Let's be conservative when rolling out new features on mainnet. Using some "oh no that's not fair because of historic reason" reasoning doesn't hold any water with me)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> I would not be opposed to a reasonable increase

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> note that there is a fundamental difference between blobs and calldata. It's economically difficult to pack large calldata consistently in competition with all other EVM usage whereas blobs target and would essentially always have high (2/4 or 3/6) values

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> the concern here is not sustained load though, which does not seem to have created any problems, but griefing one proposer (or some attesters) by making an overfull block. So I don't see how that makes much difference

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> Again, there is also a big difference in that blobs are decoupled

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> yes, this is more to address Marius‚Äô concerns around brief attacks similar to our own recent big block tests. which we also did using calldata.

author: timbeiko
content:
**ACDE recap**
- We agreed to increase the 4844 blob target/limit  from 2/4 to 3/6, at least for devnet-6, which sitll is a contentious change for mainnet üòÖ 
- We expect to launch devnet-6 with this change next week. We agreed that we should aim to have full JSON RPC support for 4844 as part of devnet-7
- We finalized the Cancun scope üèùÔ∏è ! EIPs 4788 (Beacon Block Root in EVM) and 5656 (MCOPY) were included. We agreed to bound the number of block roots in 4788, and to potentially remove 5656 from the upgrade if testing or implementations are a significant bottleneck. 
- We agreed to merge this Engine API PR: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/418
- We briefly discussed the requirements for CL nodes wrt to sending attestations before having validated all current blobs, and the impact on the UX of changing CL clients. We'll continue that conversation in ACDC next week!
- Lastly, there will be a call focused on the Holesky launch next week: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/803 - it would be great if each client team could send a representative. The call is open to anyone who is interested in testnets üôÇ

author: timbeiko
content: And here's a PR with the changes to the Cancun spec: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/pull/792
